treatments.name: Chlorothalonil
treatments.application: Spray on infected areas, covering undersides of leaves
treatments.frequency: Repeat every 7–10 days during favorable conditions

organic_alternatives.name: Copper Oxychloride
organic_alternatives.application: Spray on early signs of infection, repeat weekly

prevention: Use disease-free seeds and resistant varieties
Practice crop rotation and avoid overhead irrigation
Remove and destroy infected plant debris
Apply mulching to reduce spore splash
safety_tips: Wear protective clothing and mask during spraying
Do not spray during peak sun or windy conditions

symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with grayish mold beneath
Rapid leaf yellowing and necrosis
Curling and collapse of leaves under humid conditions
Reduced fruit yield due to poor photosynthesis

treatments.name: Metalaxyl + Mancozeb
treatments.application: Spray during early infection or when conditions are humid
treatments.frequency: Every 10–14 days

organic_alternatives.name: Potassium Bicarbonate Spray
organic_alternatives.dosage: 5 g per liter with 1 ml neem oil
organic_alternatives.application: Spray weekly as a preventive

prevention: Use resistant varieties and certified seeds
Improve air circulation and avoid overcrowding
Avoid wetting leaves during irrigation
Remove and destroy infected leaves
safety_tips: Avoid entry into sprayed area for at least 12 hours
Use goggles and gloves during chemical application

symptoms: Mottled and distorted leaves with light green patches
Reduced leaf size and curling
Stunted vine growth
Fruits may be deformed, discolored, or undersized

treatments.name: Vector Control (Aphids)
treatments.application: Spray on affected foliage to control aphids
treatments.frequency: Every 7–10 days during infestation

organic_alternatives.name: Neem Oil
organic_alternatives.application: Spray every week to manage aphid population

prevention: Use virus-free seeds and resistant hybrids
Eliminate weed hosts and alternate crops
Implement reflective mulches to repel aphids
Avoid planting near infected cucurbit crops
safety_tips: Avoid inhalation and skin contact with pesticides
Wash hands and tools thoroughly after spraying
